metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0217 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4 release 2.4.38 and prior, a race condition inmod_auth_digest when running in a threaded server could allow a user withvalid credentials to authenticate using another username, bypassingconfigured access control restrictions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10').
